{"step_by_step_thinking": "The maxillary first molar is a tooth located in the upper jaw. Infections from this tooth would most likely drain into the closest anatomical space. The buccal space is the closest to the maxillary first molar, as it is located in the cheek area, adjacent to the maxilla. The submandibular, infratemporal, and infraorbital spaces are further away and less likely to be the primary site of drainage.", "answer_choice": "C. Buccal space"}
